subject: Golf
Masters Golf Tournament
Surgery and Surgeons
lead_paragraph: Seve Ballesteros developed a complication after brain tumor surgery, requiring doctors at a Spanish hospital to remove a piece of his skull to relieve pressure. Ballesteros, a 51-year-old Spaniard who won three British Opens and two Masters, was listed in stable condition but was still in intensive care. ¶Tom Watson, the winner of eight Grand Slam titles, said he planned to return for the Senior Skins Game in January after recovering from hip replacement surgery. Watson, 59, is rehabilitating at home in Kansas City, Mo., after the Oct. 2 operation. He won twice on the Champions Tour this year and was 12th on the money list in only 10 starts. watson.
